title: GE Aerospace Foundation expands global STEM training initiative, to train 4,000 students in Bengaluru

title: Air Force use would’ve slowed Chinese offensive in 1962 war: Chief of Defence Staff Chauhan
content: Over the years, the security situation has changed and the face of warfare itself has got transformed, the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) maintained

title: Kolkata neighbourhoods, citizens, businesses reel under aftermath of flood in Kolkata

title: Intermediate Range Agni-Prime Missile successfully tested from rail-based mobile launcher system
content: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said “This next generation missile is designed to cover a range up to 2000 km and is equipped with various advanced features”

title: Community groups say U.P. ban on caste-based rallies hits mobilisation
content: Some of these outfits said the move may discourage increasing awareness of marginalised communities that are seeking representation and recognition in political and social circles

title: Monsoon withdraws from flood-ravaged Punjab, neighbouring Haryana
content: Flood-ravaged Punjab had received 253.7 mm of rain in August, which was not only 74% in excess of normal but also the highest the State witnessed in the past 25 years

title: Death penalty: SC to hear on October 8 Centre's plea for victim, society-centric guidelines
content: The Centre moved the application in the top court in January 2020 and contended the existing guidelines were only "accused and convict-centric"

title: The age of India’s leaders has steadily risen
content: The age profile of the Lok Sabha has shifted markedly over the decades, with the 18th Lok Sabha being the “oldest” yet

title: New $100k H1B visa fee could threaten Indian students’ American dream
content: Indians who recently became the largest group of foreign students could be priced out of the American job market

title: Heavy rain batters Odisha; IMD says more in store, districts on alert
content: The IMD issues orange warning of heavy to very heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning at one or two places over the districts of Koraput, Nawarangpur and Nuapada

title: Leh violence LIVE updates: Situation in Ladakh under control, says govt. after statehood protest turn deadly
content: Several people were feared dead and many injured in Leh city in Ladakh as a protest seeking the constitutional safeguards of Statehood and tribal status for the UT turned violent

title: Vallabha Agraharam Street awaits civic upgrades amid daily hustle
content: Barely wide enough for two cars to pass at once, the lane is flanked by tightly packed residences, corner shops, tea stalls, and a row of small lodges that draw a steady stream of travellers

title: Delhi HC sets aside copyright order against A.R. Rahman in ‘Veera Raja Veera’ song case
content: The court’s ruling, which came on an appeal filed by Rahman, set aside the April order findings of infringement and financial liability against him

title: Motorist knocked down by speeding lorry on Anna Salai
content: Near the subway, the lorry belonging to Chennai Corporation rammed into his vehicle and dragged it for a few yards

title: Will AI help fix India’s energy demand or will its own needs surge?
content: A McKinsey report has estimated that the annual global demand for data centre capacity could rise at 19-22% from 2023 to 2030, reaching 171-219 GW, against the total current demand of 60 GW. To avoid a deficit, at least twice as much data centre capacity built since 2000 will have to be in place in less than a quarter of the time

title: We love India, want more energy trade with it: U.S. Energy Secretary
content: We want to expand our energy cooperation with India in natural gas and coal, in nuclear, in clean cooking fuels, liquid petroleum gas, India has been a star in that area. So we want nothing more than more trade, energy cooperation with India, says U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright

title: Jaishankar hosts FIPIC Foreign Ministers' meeting in New York
content: India and Pacific Island countries are development partners. Our agenda is people-centric and focused on health, technology, capacity building and training, says External Affairs Minister

title: Language consultation panel passes resolution to dissolve committee on Maharashtra three-language policy
content: The Narendra Jadhav Committee was set up in June this year to review the policy and submit its report within three months after holding public consultations with stakeholders

title: Demolition of unsafe school buildings in Ernakulam stalled by procedural delays
content: Education department had issued notices to 72 schools, asking them to demolish buildings that posed safety risk to students

title: Auditor finds discrepancies in KSINC’s financial statements on ro-ro services
content: Ro-ro and ferry boat services have incurred a cumulative loss of ₹15.36 lakh over the four-month period from February to May

title: The many facets of the legacy of Bhyrappa’s novels
content: The well-known author’s novels were translated to multiple languages and were best sellers. Some of them also ran into controversies

title: Writers recall Bhyrappa’s research, respect for criticism
content: Among his many contributions to Kannada literature, S.L. Bhyrappa’s greatest achievements was attracting new readers, especially the youth, said writers who spoke to The Hindu

title: Former BJP MP’s remarks worry party leadership in poll-bound Bihar
content: Raj Kumar Singh says he lost the 2024 LS poll owing to ‘conspiracy’ by BJP and JD(U) leaders; he also wants corruption-accused BJP leaders to either clear their names or step down

title: Kulgam resident, who ‘helped’ Pahalgam attackers, arrested in Kashmir Valley: officials
content: According to police, 26-year-old Muhammad Yousuf Katari, a resident of Kulgam, worked as an overground worker for the terror outfit behind the Pahalgam attack

title: CPI demands that Chandigarh be transferred to Punjab
content: The CPI passed a resolution declaring that Chandigarh is the capital of Punjab and should be given to that State

title: Conspiracy angle in Delhi riots case politically motivated, say activists, lawyers
content: Right to disagree is the soul of democracy, says former judge Ansari; speakers seek bail for Umar Khalid and others languishing in jail for over five years without trial

title: ‘Psycho killer’ Parmar shot dead during crime scene reconstruction in Ahmedabad
content: Parmar allegedly snatched a firearm from a patrol team personnel and opened fire while attempting to escape. The police retaliated, leading to his death on spot, says DGP Vikas Sahay

title: Sivaganga custodial death case: CBI gets six weeks to complete probe into custodial death case
content: A Division Bench of Justices Anita Sumanth and C. Kumarappan also directed the CBI to complete the probe into the alleged theft of jewellery linked to the case, and file the final report in both cases.

title: Extension of service of Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan
content: He shall also continue to function as Secretary to the Government of India, Department of Military Affairs

title: NIA takes over probe into ₹18.85-crore bank robbery in 2023
content: The robbery happened on November 30, 2023, and was allegedly committed by armed operatives of the Eastern Flank of the National Socialist Council of Nagaland/Isak Muivah, led by one P. Joseph

title: Simultaneous polls committee meets Montek Singh Ahluwalia, Arvind Panagariya
content: Sources said Mr. Ahluwalia maintained there was no evidence to show simultaneous elections would increase GDP by 1.5%; Mr. Panagariya and Surjit S. Bhalla concurred with report of High-Level Committee

title: Dasara celebrations: Rain likely to play spoilsport in Vijayawada
content: Heavy to very heavy rainfall expected in the city on September 26 and 27; IMD predicts heavy rain forecast for the State, thanks to a fresh low-pressure area that is likely to form on September 25

title: Supreme Court urged to fill up nearly 5000 vacancies in district courts
content: Petitions to the top court call for an ‘integrated’ approach to filling up the over 5,000 vacancies in district courts

title: BJP dismisses Congress’s 10-point plan for EBCs in Bihar as a ‘sham’
content: BJP national president and MP Sambit Patra alleged that the Congress had a long history of being opposed to the policy of reservation, particularly for the Other Backward Classes (OBCs).

title: Indrakeeladri sees surge in devotees on third day of Dasara festivities
content: Nearly 58,000 devotees thronged the hillock as the Kanaka Durga temple was thrown open for darshan from the early hours; temple authorities cancel ₹500 tickets and the VIP darshan slot in the afternoon considering Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan’s visit

title: Maharashtra rain: Government to provide compensation before Diwali to farmers, relax panchnama norms
content: Over the last five days, districts in Marathwada and the Western Maharashtra region faced a flood-like situation, with 10 dead, thousands of animals killed and people displaced, and crops on about 70 lakh acres have been damaged

title: No interim relief for journalist against gag order over reporting on Adani Enterprises
content: Delhi court issues notice to the company on media portal Newslaundry’s plea against ex-parte gag order

title: After studying a 160-year-old code, Supreme Court upholds rescinding of grant of land parcels by Portugal
content: The protracted court battle over the land began when the State administration, through the Collector, rescinded the Portuguese grants in 1974

title: Tamil Nadu Youth Congress organises ‘Vote Chori’ explainer event
content: Arun Bhasker, senior vice-president, Tamil Nadu Youth Congress, took everyone through a demonstration of how deletion forms were filled up fraudulently.

title: NIRF ranking system has to be objective, transparent, says Dharmendra Pradhan
content: The Education Minister says Union government is giving NIRF and NAAC institutions utmost autonomy, “but they have to function transparently and improve in their governance”

title: ED searches premises linked to BC Jindal group entities as part of FEMA probe
content: It is suspected that funds from India have been placed in  overseas entities owned by the group in contravention of provisions of the FEMA

title: Rockwool Group’s ₹550 crore Cheyyar plant to be operational from mid-2026
content: The Cheyyar plant will be larger than Rockwool’s existing facility in Gujarat and will serve as a key production hub for the company in India.

title: Raleigh hits home run No. 60! A monthly breakdown of the slugger's historic 2025 campaign
content: The Mariners slugger just joined an elite club by mashing his 60th homer. Here's a look back at the road that got him here.

title: Guardians overtake Tigers with historical surge
content: The Guardians became the first MLB team to overcome a deficit of 15½ games and take the lead in either division or league play, beating Detroit to take a one-game lead.

title: Judge reaches 50 HRs, tying record, then adds 51
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge tied a major league record held by Babe Ruth, Mark McGwire and Sammy Sosa by reaching 50 home runs for the fourth time.

title: Phils seal 1st-round bye behind team-record 8 HRs
content: The Phillies bashed a team-record eight home runs, including three from Edmundo Sosa, and wrapped up a first-round bye in the playoffs with an 11-1 win over the Marlins.

title: Messi scores twice, Miami clinches playoff berth
content: Lionel Messi scored twice as Inter Miami cruised to a 4-0 win over New York City FC to secure a spot in the MLS postseason.

title: IU's Moore wins eligibility suit, can play rest of '25
content: Indiana starting safety Louis Moore is eligible to play the rest of the 2025 season after a judge ruled the NCAA's five-year eligibility rule violated the Texas Antitrust Act.

title: SEC loses few annual rivalries, but coaches 'get it'
content: Under the new SEC scheduling format, some longstanding rivalries will no longer be annual affairs -- such as LSU-Alabama, LSU-Florida and Tennessee-Georgia.

content: One of college football's most polarizing figures, the Ole Miss coach opens up about changing his image.

title: For A's fans, new city, same anger
content: A year after the move to West Sacramento, franchise still grapples with low attendance and outrage at owner.

content: Everyone seems to have an opinion on DeChambeau ahead of the 2025 Ryder Cup. But one thing is clear: His U.S. teammates expect him to have a big impact this week.

title: From Liverpool to Wrexham, are U.S. owners taking over English football?
content: In 2025, 11 of the 20 Premier League teams are majority owned by U.S. groups, with many more in the lower leagues. What does it all mean, and where is it going?

title: Her on-field success was unparalleled. Now Alex Morgan aims for the same heights in business
content: World Cup champion Alex Morgan has swapped the locker room for the board room. It's a move the former USWNT star plotted for years.

content: At 3-0, the Colts are now favored to win the AFC South after entering the season as underdogs to reach the playoffs.

content: From 1998 to 2008, Minnesota wore this look, making eight straight playoff appearances and a West finals run.

title: US Closing The Door On Global Talent? Indians React To H-1B Fee Hike
content: The H-1B visa has long been an important pathway for Indian professionals to work in the United States, especially in the fields of technology, engineering, and healthcare. For many Indians, it has symbolised the realisation of the "American Dream."

title: Who Is Mohammad Katari, Teacher Arrested For Helping Pahalgam Terrorists
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Wednesday arrested a 26-year-old man in connection with the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists, including a Nepal citizen, on April 22.

title: Congress Leader Charged Over Ladakh Violence, BJP Claims He Was Part Of Mob
content: Congress Councilor Phuntsog Stanzin Tsepag has been charged over the massive violence in Ladakh yesterday, for which the government has blamed climate activist Sonam Wangchuk and his provocative speeches.

title: Canada's Foreign Minister Anita Anand To Visit India Next Month As Ties Reset: What's On Agenda
content: Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand is set to visit India next month, where she will meet External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, sources told NDTV.

title: Trump Aide's "Don't Want To Punish India" Remark And A Crude Suggestion
content: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright has urged India to reconsider its purchases of discounted Russian crude and said Washington does not intend to punish New Delhi with punitive tariffs, but aims to bring an end to Moscow's military actions in Ukraine.

title: "3 Very Sinister Events": Trump Calls For Arrests Over UN 'Triple Sabotage'
content: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that he was the victim of "three very sinister events" during his time at the United Nations on Tuesday and that the Secret Service will be looking into the issues.

title: From Bulla To Bobolee: 12 Caribbean Words Added In Oxford English Dictionary
content: The Caribbean has elbowed its way into the Oxford English Dictionary with 12 new words commonly used in the region that officials publicly recognised on Wednesday.

title: Hyderabad Man Loses Rs 26 Lakh In Digital Arrest Linked To Pahalgam Attack
content: A 68-year-old man has been cheated of Rs 26.06 lakh by cyber scammers in Hyderabad who exploited a real-world tragedy to create a terrifying web of deception.

title: Marco Rubio Meets Russia's Lavrov On Sidelines Of UN General Assembly
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio held a meeting with Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on the sidelines of the High-Level Week of the 80th Session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA).

title: Trump Snubs Biden With Autopen Photo On New Presidential Walk Of Fame
content: President Donald Trump has added a Presidential Walk of Fame to the exterior of the White House, featuring portraits of each of the previous commanders-in-chief  except for one.

title: Delhi Gets Six Switching Substations To Power 1,200 E-Buses
content: Delhi Chief Minister on Wednesday inaugurated six new switching sub-stations at key DTC bus depots, aimed at providing dedicated electricity for nearly 1,200 e-buses and strengthening the city's electric public transport network.

title: 2 Detainees Killed, 1 Injured In Sniper Attack On US Immigration Facility
content: Two detainees were killed and one wounded in a sniper attack Wednesday on a US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) facility in the Texas city of Dallas, officials said.

title: "This Wasn't A Coincidence": Trump Demands Probe Into UN Escalator Glitch
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday called for an investigation into what he called "triple sabotage" after an escalator, teleprompter and sound system malfunctioned as he went to speak at the United Nations.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Hits Decade-High Ratings On Return After Suspension
content: Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel had his biggest audience in a decade when he returned to US TV screens a week after pressure from Donald Trump's government saw him forced off the air, Disney said Wednesday.

title: Trump-Epstein "Best Friends Forever" Statue Removed From DC's National Mall
content: A statue depicting President Donald Trump and late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein holding hands and kicking up their heels was removed on Wednesday from the National Mall in Washington, where it had been put on display clandestinely.

title: Ladakh Violence: 4 Dead, 80 Injured, Centre Says Situation Under Control
content: The Union Home Ministry on Wednesday said that the situation in Ladakh is under control and that there have been no incidents of violence since 4 pm.

title: Trump Poised To Add Japan Stop To Upcoming Asia Trip
content: U.S. and Japanese officials are making arrangements for a trip by President Donald Trump to Japan next month, according to two government officials and another person briefed on the matter.

title: Man Robbed Of Jewellery Worth Rs 1 Crore At Gunpoint In Delhi: Cops
content: A man carrying jewellery worth around Rs 1 crore on his scooter was allegedly robbed at gunpoint on Wednesday by bike-borne assailants near Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi, police said.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu Rejects Western Recognitions Of Palestinian State
content: The recent recognitions by some Western nations of a Palestinian state will not "bind Israel in any way," Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Delhi ‘godman’ on the run: 5 FIRs, 6 fake UN plates; arrested and let off in 2016 sex abuse case
content: Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, already facing multiple cases including sexual harassment and fraud, is now on the run following fresh allegations at a Delhi institute. Police investigations revealed Saraswati allegedly targeted vulnerable girls, promising them opportunities in exchange for compliance.

title: Delhi BMW crash: Car didn't hit victim's bike, accused tells court
content: In the Delhi BMW accident case, Gaganpreet Makkad pleaded in court that her car did not hit the finance official's motorbike. Her counsel argued for bail, citing CCTV footage discrepancies and her efforts to get the victim medical aid quickly. The prosecution opposed, alleging Makkad prioritized avoiding legal trouble over the victim's wishes.

title: Gesture at Asia Cup: BCCI, PCB file official complaints with ICC
content: The BCCI has formally accused Pakistani cricketers Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan of provocative gestures during an Asia Cup match, prompting the PCB to counter with a complaint against Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav for alleged political comments. Rauf's actions, including mimicking a plane crash, and Farhan's gun-firing celebration are under scrutiny by the ICC, potentially leading to sanctions.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
content: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.

title: CBSE date sheet 2026: Class 12th science tentative schedule released
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education has published the tentative exam schedule for Class 12 Science students for 2026. Students can find the schedule on cbse.gov.in. The board will conduct exams for about 45 lakh students in India and abroad. Evaluation of answer scripts will start after exams. Students should regularly check the website for updates.

title: 'Amazing that Melania & I didn’t fall': Trump claims 'triple sabotage' at UN; recalls '3 sinister events'
content: During his UN visit, President Trump encountered a series of technical glitches, including a stalled escalator, a malfunctioning teleprompter, and audio problems. Trump alleged "sabotage," citing a prior report and his wife's inability to hear his speech.

title: H-1B lottery may go: US plans new system; Indian workers may be hit
content: The Trump administration has proposed a significant overhaul of the H-1B visa program, replacing the lottery system with a merit-based selection favoring highly skilled and highly paid applicants. This reform, coupled with a substantial fee hike, aims to curb system abuse and prioritize the 'best and brightest,' potentially impacting Indian IT professionals and reshaping the global IT services market.

title: Ahmedabad man sets wife and her mother on fire over domestic dispute, 1 dead
content: In Ahmedabad's Kubernagar, Ashok Rajput allegedly set his wife, Jaya, and mother-in-law, Shobhana, on fire at a beauty parlour following a domestic dispute. Jaya succumbed to her injuries during treatment, while Shobhana is critically injured.

title: K-visa tempts, H-1B tests patience: Where should STEM grads head next?
content: The global battle for STEM talent is intensifying, with U.S. H-1B visas becoming costly and restrictive under Trump-era policies, while China launches its K-visa, offering sponsorship-free, multi-entry, long-term stays for young science and technology graduates. For Indian students abroad, the choice is stark: navigate America’s bureaucratic hurdles or seize Beijing’s predictable, opportunity-rich path.

title: Silicon Valley investor slams H-1B changes: Benefits foreign rivals; misguided
content: Silicon Valley investor Michael Moritz has denounced President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it will stifle innovation and reflects a misunderstanding of the tech sector's success. He argues that companies hire skilled foreign nationals due to labor shortages, not to replace American workers.

title: Trump ‘Bye-dens' Joe's portrait with autopen at 'Presidential Walk of Fame'- Watch
content: Donald Trump unveiled a "Presidential Walk of Fame" at the White House, replacing Joe Biden's portrait with an autopen image, mocking his predecessor. Trump has repeatedly accused Biden of using the autopen to conceal cognitive decline. This snub is Trump's boldest attempt to criticize Biden, as he reshapes the White House to his preferences.

title: Abhishek Sharma’s sister sends heartwarming message after Asia Cup heroics
content: Abhishek Sharma's impressive 75 propelled India to a 41-run victory over Bangladesh in the Asia Cup Super 4, securing their spot in the final. Despite his run-out denying him a century, his sister Komal remains optimistic, crediting Yuvraj Singh's mentorship. Sharma also broke records, hitting 17 sixes in the tournament.

title: PM Modi-Trump meet soon? Here's what US official said
content: A US official confirmed a potential meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Donald Trump, highlighting their "very positive relationship." Despite trade and visa tensions, Trump has praised Modi and their "very special" connection. Recent discussions between officials signal ongoing efforts to address priority areas amidst looming trade deadlines.

title: Gabrielle Union: ‘No job is worth unease’—on Hollywood’s dark side
content: Popular actress Gabrielle Union revealed how a past sexual assault shaped her Hollywood career. She avoids projects with unsettling individuals, prioritizing her well-being. Union values positive environments over financial gain. Despite past trauma, she achieved success. Her marriage to Dwyane Wade is strong. The couple focuses on family and business ventures. Wade supports Union, and they navigate life together.

title: Agassi–Graf 2025 net worth: Inside tennis power couple’s fortune
content: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: Why Guardians’ David Fry was hospitalized during key Tigers win
content: In a shocking incident, David Fry was injured during a game between the Cleveland Guardians and the Detroit Tigers. A fastball hit Fry in the face. He was immediately taken to the hospital for treatment. The game continued, and the Guardians secured a victory. The team and players expressed their concern for Fry's well-being.

title: Rs 66,500 crore deal for 97 Tejas jets, largest ever, may be inked today
content: India is set to finalize a massive Rs 66,500 crore deal with HAL for 97 Tejas Mark-1A fighters, even as the Air Force grapples with dwindling squadron numbers and delays in the delivery of previously ordered jets. This procurement aims to bolster India's air capabilities amid concerns about regional adversaries and technological advancements.

title: Denmark’s Aalborg airport shut after drones spotted in airspace; flights affected
content: Aalborg airport in Denmark was shut down due to drone sightings, mirroring a similar disruption at Copenhagen airport earlier in the week. The incidents prompted investigations involving national intelligence and the armed forces, with authorities also looking into drone activity near other airports.

title: India mostly with us, says Zelenskyy, hopes for more
content: President Zelensky expressed optimism that India is largely supportive of Ukraine and hopes former President Trump can persuade New Delhi to cease purchasing Russian oil. Trump, in a shift from his previous stance, now believes Ukraine can reclaim all its territory with EU and NATO support. This change occurred after Zelensky met with Trump during the UN General Assembly.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for September 25- check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha recommends buying NTPC, Bank of Baroda, and Aadhar Housing Finance Ltd. He anticipates Nifty reaching 25600+ and Bank Nifty targeting 56400.

title: ‘Very friendly, very pleasant’: Brazil’s Lula on brief UNGA encounter with Trump
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva and US President Trump had a surprisingly positive first encounter at the UN General Assembly, despite recent tensions over tariffs and sanctions related to Jair Bolsonaro's conviction. Both leaders expressed optimism about future relations, with Trump describing Lula as a "very nice man" and Lula emphasizing the importance of dialogue and mutual respect.

title: Asia Cup: After Haris Rauf; PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi gets into jet-downing controversy
content: The Asia Cup is marred by political gestures as Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi endorsed controversial actions, including a fighter-jet gesture, sparking outrage. This follows similar provocations by players like Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan. While Pakistan faces criticism, India's on-field performance, highlighted by Abhishek Sharma and Kuldeep Yadav, secured their spot in the Asia Cup final.

title: Magic Johnson in awe: Crawford vs Canelo showdown; 70,000 fans witness epic fight
content: Terence Crawford and Canelo Alvarez fight drew huge crowds. Magic Johnson attended the fight. Crawford won against Alvarez. The fight had over 70,000 fans and generated over $47 million. Over 41 million viewers watched on Netflix. Crawford is now a three-division undisputed champion. A rematch is debated. Eddie Hearn thinks Canelo knew Crawford's style was difficult. Canelo's ranking has dropped.

title: Karnataka HC rejects X plea, backs social media regulation
content: The Karnataka High Court dismissed X Corp's petition against content takedowns, asserting that Indian constitutional law prevails over American free speech standards. The court emphasized the necessity of regulating social media, particularly to protect women's dignity, and stated that foreign corporations cannot claim fundamental rights in India. It upheld the government's Sahyog portal as a legitimate tool for combating cybercrime.

title: Mike Greenberg reacts: Shedeur Sanders’ draft drop; Browns’ QB strategy debated
content: Shedeur Sanders' unexpected slide in the NFL Draft has sparked debate, especially after the Browns picked Dillon Gabriel earlier. Analyst Mike Greenberg questions this decision, noting that pre-draft analysis consistently ranked Sanders higher. Despite being a third-string quarterback, Sanders remains focused, supported by his father Deion's emphasis on starting opportunities.

title: Popular breakfasts linked to cancer risk: Top US doctor warns' rethink your morning meal
content: Dr. Saurabh Sethi warns that common American breakfast choices like bacon, sugary cereals, granola, pancakes, and donuts can be detrimental to long-term health. These foods, often loaded with nitrates, added sugars, and unhealthy fats, are linked to chronic illnesses such as cancer, diabetes, and obesity.

title: Venezuela earthquake: 6.2-magnitude tremor rattles northwest region
content: A significant 6.2-magnitude earthquake struck northwest Venezuela, causing buildings to shake and prompting evacuations across several states and neighboring Colombia. The quake, with its epicenter near Mene Grande in Zulia state, was felt in major cities like Caracas and Maracaibo.

title: Why didn't you hang him: Supreme Court to govt on Beant killer
content: The Supreme Court has criticized the Union government for opposing the consideration of Balwant Singh Rajoana's plea for commutation of his death sentence, who was convicted in the 1995 assassination of Punjab CM Beant Singh.

title: Assam forms SIT to probe Zubeen Garg's death
content: Assam police have launched a special investigation team to examine the circumstances surrounding singer Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore, with a second autopsy's viscera being sent for forensic analysis in Delhi. Following public outcry and multiple FIRs, the Assam CM has blacklisted the festival organizer involved and promised a thorough investigation.

title: As ties thaw, Canadian foreign minister set to visit India next month
content: Following a meeting between PM Modi and Mark Carney, India and Canada are poised to normalize relations, with Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand likely to visit New Delhi next month. This marks the first high-level bilateral visit since 2023.

title: Portuguese-era case resolved by Supreme Court 78 yrs after Independence
content: The Supreme Court upheld a 1974 decision regarding land rights in Dadra and Nagar Haveli, resolving a dispute stemming from Portuguese colonial rule. The court dismissed appeals against a High Court decision, affirming the government's power to reclaim land previously granted by the Portuguese administration. Justices expressed concern over lingering colonial-era disputes in independent India.

title: Ladakh violence planned, not spontaneous: Officials
content: The central government believes the Ladakh violence was premeditated, despite scheduled talks with Ladakhi representatives. Officials question the motives behind the violence, pointing to Sonam Wangchuk's past calls for protests and Congress leaders' inflammatory statements. The government suspects a conspiracy to incite youth and reaffirms its commitment to finding solutions for Ladakh's empowerment.

title: 'OG' Twitter review: Pawan Kalyan’s aura wins fans; netizens say 'It's mass thriller'
content: Pawan Kalyan's 'OG' has ignited social media with fan reactions following its release. While early reviews are mixed, particularly regarding the first half's pacing, Pawan Kalyan's presence and Thaman's music are being widely praised. Emraan Hashmi's Telugu debut as the antagonist is also generating significant buzz, with some calling him the film's standout performer.

title: Asia Cup: India’s fielding under fire- Chakravarthy blames 'Ring of Fire' for team's fielding woes
content: India may be unbeaten in the Asia Cup, but their fielding has been a major concern, with 12 catches dropped so far, nine in the last two games. Varun Chakravarthy admitted there can be no excuses and stressed the need to improve ahead of the final, even as he detailed how bowling adjustments and match experience are boosting his confidence.

title: India may buy more oil from US, says Piyush Goyal
content: India signals potential increase in US oil imports amid pressure to diversify from Russian crude, aiming to strengthen energy security and reduce the trade deficit. Discussions between Indian and US officials are ongoing to finalize a trade deal, addressing concerns like secondary sanctions and reciprocal tariffs. The US expresses strong interest in expanding energy cooperation with India across various sectors.

title: ‘Despicable’: Trump condemns Dallas ICE shooting; blames 'left-leaning' Democrats
content: President Trump condemned the deadly shooting at the Dallas ICE Field Office, attributing the violence to radical leftists and their rhetoric against law enforcement. He cited threats from domestic extremist groups like ANTIFA and announced plans to dismantle domestic terrorism networks.

title: No data to contrary, lower age of consent, says amicus
content: The Supreme Court is set to hear petitions regarding lowering the age of consent, with amicus curiae Indira Jaising arguing that adolescents are capable of mature consent due to earlier puberty. Interveners, however, fear it could lead to exploitation and child marriages, advocating for case-by-case evaluation instead of blanket immunity under the Pocso Act.

title: NMC turns 5, with no patient appeals heard
content: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has faced criticism for rejecting all patient complaints in its five years of existence, despite its mandate to regulate the medical profession in the public interest. A draft amendment allowing patient appeals to the Ethics and Medical Registration Board (EMRB) has stalled.

title: Savannah James opens up; lost herself young; life as LeBron’s wife & mom
content: Savannah James, wife of NBA star LeBron James, recently shared her journey of self-discovery on her podcast, 'Everybody's Crazy.' She revealed feeling lost in her roles as a wife and mother, admitting her identity was consumed by her family. Savannah emphasized the importance of reclaiming personal time and interests, even taking solo trips to rediscover herself beyond her family responsibilities.

title: Comedian-in-chief: Trump at UN - why world no longer takes him seriously
content: At the UN General Assembly, Donald Trump's speech, criticizing the UN and international norms, drew reactions of pity rather than concern. His 'America First' approach is isolating the US, prompting allies to question its reliability. Nations are hedging their bets, drawing closer to China and Russia, as Trump's unpredictability undermines US credibility.

title: To join shipbuilding big league, govt to pump in Rs 70,000 crore
content: India's government has approved a massive Rs 70,000 crore package to boost its shipbuilding industry, aiming to compete with global leaders like China and South Korea. The initiative includes financial assistance, a development fund, and a scheme to enhance technical skills. It seeks to generate Rs 4.

title: TikTok deal: Trump to approve agreement today, White House confirms
content: US President Donald Trump is expected to sign the TikTok deal on Thursday, according to a White House source. This follows a productive call with Chinese President Xi Jinping, where the TikTok agreement was discussed. Negotiators have until December 16 to finalize terms.

title: Has Clemson hit rock bottom in the Bottom 10?
content: "Pale September," a tan line from the bottom 10 headquarters, is coming to a close . the days remaining in September have dwindled into single digits, soon to be followed by single-digit temperatures in those pools . for many, September can't wrap up soon enough, he says .

title: Caleb Williams, Isaiah Rodgers join Madden NFL 26 Team of the Week 3
content: totw is a program that runs alongside the season and delivers weekly content releases featuring athletes who've had standout performances in the previous week's games . the champions and heroes categories feature players such as the Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver A.J. Brown , Cleveland Browns running back Quinshon Judkins , and Pittsburgh Steelers defensive end T. J. Watt .

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in Week 4
content: the first major upset of the season ended with 72% of all entrants eliminated . this week, the Buffalo Bills are the largest favorites so far as they host the winless New Orleans Saints . the smaller the group, the better the pick the Bills - as immediate win probability matters more .

title: 💍 D'Angelo Russell gets engaged to girlfriend
content: Dallas Mavericks  point guard  D'Angelo Russell  is officially engaged. Russell's now-fiancée, Laura Ivaniukas announced their engagement Tuesday with a joint post on Instagram captioned: "Ms to Mrs.. Loading," seemingly referencing the  nickname he has embraced  since being drafted in 2015 by the  Los Angeles Lakers . A post shared by Laura Ivaniukas (@laura.iva) According to  People , Russell and Ivaniukas met at a New York Fashion Week event before eventually going public with their relationship in 2020. The couple have two children together. They welcomed son Riley Russell in 2022 and daughter Mila-Rose Russell in 2024. Russell agreed to a  two-year, $13 million deal  with the Mavericks in June, with the second season in the deal being a player option. He averaged 12.6 points, 2.8 rebounds and 5.1 assists with the Lakers and  Brooklyn Nets  in 2024-25. The Nets acquired Russell from the Lakers in a January deal. He is heading into his ninth NBA season.

title: Silent Hill f review -- A stunning comeback for the horror series
content: Silent Hill f is the best horror game in the series to date . it sees players stepping into the shoes of Hinako Shimizu, a high school girl in rural 1960s . her parents control every aspect of her life, and her only escape is in the comfort of her childhood friends .

title: The inside scoop on Jerry Jones' business ways
content: it has been a common practice for Jones and executive vice president Stephen Jones over the years to engage with their star players in hopes of convincing them to sign a new deal . there is nothing in the collective bargaining agreement that explicitly prevents the discussions . several agents said it is not a good look to circumvent them and go to the player who might not know all the details .

title: Top storylines to watch at the 2025 Ryder Cup
content: team USA captain Keegan Bradley and team Europe captain Luke Donald are both eager and ready for the 2025 Ryder Cup to begin Friday . the first match of the day will go off at 7:10 a.m. the parings for the first four matches will be announced Thursday afternoon .
